contest-event.event-date: Sept. 28, 1935 D National Championship of Great Britain (Crystal Palace) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Pride of Race Crystal Palace (Concert Hall), Crystal Palace Park, Sydenham, County of London, England, UK A. Wood was appointed referee. Prizes: 1st: 50 Pounds plus the 1000 Guinea Trophy 2nd: 45 Pounds plus the Daily Telegraph Challenge Cup 3rd: 40 Pounds plus the W W Grant Memorial Trophy 4th: 35 Pounds 5th: 30 Pounds 6th: 10 Pounds May 5, 2010, 11:21 a.m. Aug. 28, 2013, 1:30 p.m. 1 The GUS Band William Halliwell 2 Creswell Colliery Band Joseph Farrington 3 Black Dyke Band William Halliwell 4 Besses o' th' Barn Willie Wood 5 Baxendale's Works J. A. Greenwood 6 Bickershaw Colliery J. A.
